review_title: Awesome company who really cares for employees
pros:
I have been working with CS for over a year now, some out of many things I liked in this company:
Truly cares for employees.
Good work life balance, loads of public holidays and time-off.
Management is highly supportive.
There is no micro-management.
You rise high truly based on your calibre and not by bootlicking anybody.
They emphasize on your personal development as well.
Pays really high as compared to other companies.
Perks and bonus over and above salary.
Here you will find some of the best minds in industry.
Even though PF deduction is more (unlike service based companies where they deduct PF as a penny), but it only helps you in the long run, and a really handsome amount of money gets accumulated in your PF account in a very short span of time.
cons: Really no cons to share.

Many many nice words and charts. Institutionally rotten.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros:
Nice gym
Good location in NYC - near MAdison Square Park
Decent 401k and benefits
Brand appears to be resilient on paper / good for resume
cons:
Racism issues are well known and documented in media (read NY Times).  The problem exists at highest levels in company (Chairman, c suite)

Somebody in c suite also seems to habitually hire spies to follow employees - the problem keeps coming up over and over in media, with new incidents. Apparently mgmt doesn't learn from its "mistakes"

The MD layer and even most Directors are generally people who have worked in the bank for 15+ years and insulated/unaware of any modern work practices. 

Expect unreasonable workloads, firedrills, constant decision changes and constant cost cutting.

Ethics issues are rampant - HR protects the guilty, while getting rid of those who raise legitimte complaints
